definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to run off in a great panic (idiom)

sentences.english: He escaped impetuously, like the wolf who finds his cage open.
sentences.chinese: 他象一头狼，看见笼门开了，总要慌忙出逃。

sentences.english: Lawrence, in his novels created 12 escapee images, who as an integrated whole serve the inherent connections and logical development.
sentences.chinese: 劳伦斯在他的小说中共塑造了12位出逃者的形象。

sentences.english: An attack by a krayt dragon derailed their escape plans.
sentences.chinese: 他们在路上遭到一头克雷特龙的攻击，出逃计划搁浅。

sentences.english: The couple had eloped from their hometown.
sentences.chinese: 这对情侣从家乡私奔出逃。

sentences.english: Jin prince Chong'er ran away from the country with his supporters due to persecution.
sentences.chinese: 晋国公子重耳因受到迫害，率其支持者出逃。

sentences.english: If you can, flee immediately, for the Storm Hag is right beside you.
sentences.chinese: 如果您能，风暴女巫的直接出逃，在您旁边是不错。

sentences.english: He fled in panic, all the way Elegy.
On the other hand, Luo Xiuxian did not execute instructions to escape the culprit.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，罗秀贤没有执行元凶的指示而私自出逃。

sentences.english: Who is Zhang Xinming driving force behind the exodus?
sentences.chinese: 谁是张新明出逃的幕后推手？

sentences.english: Flees completely safe causes Ding Luoshan to suspend the inspection, Liu Yong becomes acts bureau chief.
sentences.chinese: 万全出逃导致丁洛山被停职检查，刘勇成为代理局长。

definition: to dump (selling abroad more cheaply than cost price at home)
to run off in a great panic (idiom)
to flee abroad/to run away/to desert/outflow
to run away/to go into exile
to convert (an asset) into cash/to cash out
to take funds (esp. illegally or corruptly obtained)
refuge/to take refuge/to seek asylum (political etc)
